caption: Great food and cocktails. The food was perfect for spring. Cool ambiance.

Wow! What I love about NYC is you can walk down your neighborhood block (any block) and eat at a restaurant that rivals the best restaurants of just about any other city.  So it is with Leland etc., etc. We were just searching for a new, local restaurant with outside dining (due to covid). But we somehow managed to score one of this restaurant's two outside, self-contained dining pods. It's like... eating at home except with you own chef and servers... my kind of set-up.  Anyway, loved eating outside/but not truly outside, on a nice, non-busy residential street. The music in our pod was great, the service was excellent, the cocktails were decent (a bit sweet but very balanced), they had delicious wines by the glass, but the food...  The food, man... you can always tell when a chef just knows how to "burn". These guys are the real deal- you can teach technique, but you can't teach a great palate.  OK, OK... the food.  We started off with the smoked pollock fritters and the focaccia. Those fritters- when I saw them I was like, "man, I hope those taste as good as they look." They effin' did! A glorius combination of flavors complemented by a tzatziki sauce with fresh chunks of cucumber. The dish was like magic.  "But was that all?" you ask. Not by a long shot. They didn't have the chicken jook which is what we really wanted, so we skipped the "plates" and went straight for their entrees...  Of which we had all three (don't judge)... So, in order of wonderful to wonderful:  We started off with a whole fish. I know this isn't for everyone because it requires a bit of work. But this fish was made special by an excellent fennel salad which went so well with the fish we were fighting over the last bite.  Next was the "pork and beans". I don't know what kind of pork that was but if it were here right now I'd marry it (then eat it- so much for love). The gigante beans in what tasted like a spicy paprika oil was the perfect combination.  And finally, the chicken. If you know me you know I love roast chicken. This would be the second best roast chicken I've had in the last few years. Out of all the dishes this one was the most special.  We finished our dinner off by having the crème brûlée pie. Sweet, light- the perfect ending to a perfect meal.  This was the best meal we've had in NYC in months. Try it before the hype becomes too real and the reservation too impossible...
The best meal I’ve had all year! Try the whole fish, bitter green salad and pork & beans! Their baked pastries are divine too! Took them to go and had them this morning with coffee. We love Leland!
Such good food and nice atmosphere innovative eating and dining

This fairly new place in this neighborhood,  but already made it name. So I decided to go and see myself what all this hype about. And I was not disappointed,  rather simple but very creative drink and food menu full of local producers. The food was unique and very tasty. Unless you have an allergy or really can't stand mussels,  you should really order it. This is probably the best mussels I ever had. All other things were good too. I really like their cream Brule pie. So all in all very nice, tasty and reasonably priced restaurant.
Awesome fusion menu, everything we tried was great. Friendly service direct from the owners. Highly recommend.

I had the pleasure of eating in one of the cabins. One of the golden treasures of Leland is Jeannette. She  treats everyone equally and makes you feel  welcome. The food is absolutely delicious and you get excellent service. I welcome Leland to the neighborhood! ❤️❤️

We had an incredible dinner in one of the outdoor cabins a few weeks ago. The meal was so memorable, I’m still thinking about ribollita soup and focaccia 🤤. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner, Randi, who walked us through his restaurant’s thoughtfully and sustainably sourced menu. Wow, the level of detail and care that went into each dish is impressive. The restaurant itself is well thought out and you can see the level of precaution the staff is taking to protect guests, as well as themselves. It’s one of the few meals I’ve enjoyed out during covid. It almost felt like 2019. I’m looking forward to my next visit. Thanks, Randi and staff!

Fantastic experience. Every single menu item was delicious and bursting with powerful flavors. The reviews didn’t let this place down, and i’m glad we came! This is a boutique style restaurant, so you’re going to have a heavy gluten free and vegetarian favoring menu, with a lot of homemade items. With that comes a slightly heavier price point and smaller portions, but it’s worth checking it out! The drinks were delicious as well, and the employees made us feel at home!  Food: 10/10 Where do I start. The pollok fritters were very tasty, the perfect mix of many flavors of smokiness, fish, and bringing it together with the tzatziki sauce, in a fluffy hush puppy style ball. The eggplant was ridiculously good, but the brussel sprouts stole the show. I didn’t think ever in my life I’d say that brussel sprouts would be the best thing i had that evening, but here we are. Delicious and loaded with flavor. The chicken was surprisingly good but nothing life changing. The pork and beans was also a solid dish but also nothing to write home about for me. Every dish was unique, and had strong flavor, something that I personally value very heavily (even if it means being a little salty or saucy). I really don’t think you can go wrong with any menu item here at this place. Everything was cooked to perfection, and I couldn’t find any critiques.  Menu: As aforementioned, it’s a heavy gluten free and especially vegetarian style menu. You couldn’t tell any of these items were lacking gluten if you tried, so that was irrelevant. The limited amount of protein and or meat options was a little lackluster for me personally, but the amazing quality of the brussel sprouts make up for that entirely. The menu is fairly balanced though, so I feel that there are still options for everyone. The dishes are made to be shared which allows skeptical eaters to get their mouths full of trying something new.  Value: 3/5 Like any boutique style restaurant, expect to pay a little too much for small portions of vegetables. We split 4 small plates and 2 big plates, along with 6 drinks for a little over $200. I think that’s a fair price for $50 a person, however, i’ll note that i stopped and grabbed two tacos on the way home. With that being said, i’ve been to several boutique restaurants in the area and have paid more for lower quality, which is why ill give the value a fair rating.  Experience: 5/5 It’s a remodeled place, everything is chic, modern, but most importantly cozy! It doesn’t have a packed restaurant layout which makes it feel much more at home. Every seating arrangement seems to be unique compared to the one next to it. I found the tables intimate but open. I was very comfortable throughout my entire experience. The service was fantastic for the entire night. We were treated very hospitality the moment we walked through the door and while we were being taken care of. The server was very patient, and took her time to explain in great detail many of the menu items.  Closing words, this place is fantastic top to bottom. As always, the drinks aren’t rated but the mexican hot chocolate is ridiculously tasty! Trust me, just order it.

Had a fabulous dinner there last night. There was a reservation mixup but Randi and his fiance were so accommodating and professional and opened their back section just to seat us. The cocktails were on point, the food was delicious, interesting and fresh. Love this place, happy to support their business. Will be back!

Their chicken is one of the best I've ever had!  The dinner menu is limited but I respect that what they offer is done extremely well.  The wines are amazing and I look forward to making Leland one of my local go-to restaurants!

Had a really special dinner here last night and loved the Chinese New Year dishes. I forgot what a dining experience could be like. Book a cabin and you won’t be disappointed! Thank you to the staff/family for being so welcoming.

We've tasted just about everything on the menu now, and absolutely love all of it, no joke. I'm still dreaming about the Berkshire Pork Chop we had our most recent visit, as well as the 24-hour brined and air-dried chicken (so juicy). Also the pork shoulder. And the fish curry. Don't miss the small plates: the brussels sprouts, chicken jook porridge, hake fritters, and all of their baked goods. Also, good cocktails to boot, and to-go wine and liquor shop, what's not to like? Seriously, try the whole menu!  Everyone involved are absolutely the nicest people as well. It was amazing watching the entire place be built out by them and their families. Also, they love our dog, so what else could we want? I feel super lucky to have Leland in our neighborhood.

Delicious food and really nice people! The staff was kind and were really attentive. I wish Vinyl Hour offered more in the way of vegan options but the focaccia sandwich was DELICIOUS. As we’re the homemade chips! For only having one offering they really nailed it. I hope to try more if they offer additional vegan friendly menu items down the line! Great neighborhood spot.
Great food and great vibes. The menu is changing often so it’s hard to recommend a single dish, but everything we had was fabulous!

Came here on a cold Sunday night and grabbed some food to-go. While I waited I ordered a hot cider drink and enjoyed the Jook on the menu. I have never tried something more delicious, or comforting, perfect on a cold NY winter night, you MUST get the Jook when you visit. Mandatory.  To-go we ordered the Pork and Beans (amazing!), the Brussels and the Carrots. I loved the smaller sides and options as appetizers. When I got home, I quickly plated everything and enjoyed a meal as if I was sitting at their lovely restaurant.  I can't wait to come back once indoor dining re-opens, the space is clean and classic. They offer a great variety of drinks, wines and bites. Can't wait to come back soon!
Amazing addition to Prospect Heights! Have been twice now and enjoyed everything. Stand out dishes are the Pickled Mussels, Bitter Greens salad, Carrots, and the Half Chicken.

I don’t even like croutons, and I want a bowl full of Leland croutons. The pork chop, perfectly sliced, with gigante beans (which I need to have more of in my life ASAP) is yummy yummy yummy. Can’t wait for the end of covid so I can sit inside and enjoy this food in person. In the meantime, the takeout is a delicious Saturday night out meal I can enjoy at home, with the thoughtfully curated wines. Bravo!

Such a pleasant experience! Really interesting (and delicious) menu, completely reasonable prices, awesome decor, and lovely staff / wonderful service. Highly recommend the 1) rosemary focaccia, 2) pan seared scallops, and the 3) cider house cocktail. Great addition to the neighborhood. 👍👍
Delicious, well balanced food, great wine, and reasonable cocktails. Nice wait staff and good outdoor social distanced seating. The anchovy toast was delightful!

Beautifully renovated restaurant with amazing décor (the bathroom is really well done!). Great ventilation and lots of windows in case anyone is paranoid about COVID and eating indoors. Owner and staff are very friendly and easy to talk to and want to make sure you are enjoying your meal.  Food: We ordered: Roasted Squash Fritto Misto Spiced Carrots Pan Seared Scallops Fisherman's Stew  Highly recommend the Fritto misto, spiced carrots (most impressive carrot dish I have ever eaten), and pan seared scallops!  Drinks: The French pressed coffee was the best I've ever had, goes great with their pie desserts (get extra whipped cream on top)!  Definitely coming back to try the rest of their dishes!
Beautiful inside, and out, with great decor, an excellent chef It's THE place to go while in Brooklyn! Owner operators are dedicated to making EVERYTHING perfect for your visit!
Excited to try this place out when it opens🙌🏼 (Oct 3rd 2020)
